com.github.maxstupo.flatengine.animation

Class ImageSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.maxstupo.flatengine.animation.ImageSet

  • public class ImageSet
extends java.lang.Object
    This class splits a BufferedImage object into Sprites.
    Author:
    Maxstupo

      Creates a new ImageSet object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ImageSet

        public ImageSet(java.lang.String id,
                java.awt.image.BufferedImage tileset,
                int tileWidth,
                int tileHeight,
                int tileSpacing,
                int tileMargin)
        Creates a new ImageSet object.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of this ImageSet.
        tileset - the image to split.
        tileWidth - the width of the tiles in the texture.
        tileHeight - the height of the tiles in the texture.
        tileSpacing - the spacing between each tile in pixels.
        tileMargin - the spacing around the outside of all the tiles in pixels.

    • Method Detail

      • getRegions

        public java.util.List<Sprite> getRegions(int start,
                                         int end)
        Returns a list of Sprites between the specified start and end indexes.
        Parameters:
        start - the starting index.
        end - the ending index.
        Returns:
        a list of texture regions.

      • getSprite

        public Sprite getSprite(int index)
        Returns the sprite at the specified index location, or null if the specified index is out of bounds.
        Parameters:
        index - the regions index location.
        Returns:
        the sprite at the specified index location, or null if the specified index is out of bounds.

      • getSprite

        public Sprite getSprite(int i,
                        int j)
        Returns the sprite at the specified x,y location, or null if the specified index is out of bounds.
        Parameters:
        i - the index along the x-axis.
        j - the index along the y-axis.
        Returns:
        the sprite at the specified index location, or null if the specified index is out of bounds.
